subject: Career
title: Building Rapport with Mirroring
description: A micro-lesson that makes Building Rapport with Mirroring usable.

hook.text: She matched his speaking pace, posture, and vocabulary. Within minutes, he felt like they'd known each other for years.

buildup.text: Mirroring is subtly matching another person's communication style to build unconscious rapport.

discovery.text: FBI negotiator Chris Voss uses mirroring as his #1 rapport technique: repeat the last 3 words someone said.

twist.text: Mirroring works because the brain equates similarity with safety. We trust people who seem like us.

climax.text: Mirror sparingly and naturally: match energy, pace, and key phrases. Obvious mimicry feels mocking.

punchline.text: Rapport isn't magic. It's matching. Mirror naturally and trust follows.

quiz.question: How does Chris Voss use mirroring in negotiation?
options: Repeating the last 3 words someone said
